subsection.name: Useful information
subsection.p: This coverage report was created for Google Java Style (cached page) , version of March 21, 2014

p.a: Checkstyle's html report for Guava library

subsection.name: Legend
subsection.p:
"--" - There is no rule in this paragraph.
"↓" - This paragraph is the high-level point of some group.
- Existing Check covers all requirements from Google.
- Existing Check covers some part of requirements from Google.
- Requirements are not possible to check by Checkstyle at all.

td.a: 3.1 License or copyright information, if present

tr.td:
LineLength
We can detect URL with protocol type as http://, https:// etc.
JSNI could not be detected right now, but might be possible after comments and javadoc support appear in Checkstyle

td.a: 4.5.2 Indent continuation lines at least +4 spaces
4.8.2.2 Declared when needed, initialized as soon as possible

tr.td: "5.2 Rules of identifier type" already includes this rule.

MethodName
No ability to distinguish verb at the beginning of name, no way distinguish Test method from others so "_" is allowed in names
Every constant is a static final field, but not all static final fields are constants - impossible to check such rule.

AbbreviationAsWordInName
Non covered: Some words are ambiguously hyphenated in the English language. No way to distinguish "YouTubeImporter" or "YoutubeImporter".
That validation could not be checked by Checkstyle. It's need to take a look as parent class. But Checkstyle have no way open or look at another Class file.
Proper validation require parsing other files, sources are not always available.

JavadocMethod
Overrides are checked by presence of "@Override" annotation on method.
